tags: i use 'essential' loosely just read tpos 1995 tbh
ill try to keep this updated!
summary: Billy Batson is a teenager who becomes Captain Marvel, the World's Mightiest Mortal. Granted access to incredible powers by the...
caption:
Billy Batson is a teenager who becomes Captain Marvel, the World’s Mightiest Mortal. Granted access to incredible powers by the wizard Shazam, he speaks the wizard’s name and is struck by a lightning bolt that gives him the powers of the gods. He has been a member of the Justice League, Justice Society, Marvel Family and Squadron of Justice. Captain Marvel was created by C.C. Beck and Bill Parker for publication in Fawcett Comics, and is now owned by DC Comics.

FAWCETT PUBLICATIONS

  • WHIZ Comics (1940) | First appearance and adventures!
  • Captain Marvel Adventures (1941) | Extended run of WHIZ Comics.
  • America’s Greatest Comics (1941) | More standalone stories.
  • The Marvel Family (1945)* | The entire family comes together for their own series.
  • Shazam!: A Celebration of 75 Years | An anniversary anthology. Not actually a run/series or is it essential to read but I thought it gave good summaries in bulk for the overarching Captain Marvel history.

PRE-CRISIS

  • Shazam! (1973) | Beginnings of Captain Marvel within the DC universe. 

POST-CRISIS

  • The Power of SHAZAM! (1995)* | The best starter introduction series for Captain Marvel by Jerry Ordway, who does well establishing the Marvel origin into DC continuity. If you’re not feeling up for classics, you can skip up right to this and still get a good grasp of everything.
  • Shazam!: The Monster Society of Evil (2007)* | An origin retelling. This aligns to most people’s image of Billy-the-street-orphan-who’s-like-7-probably. It’s fun and Mr. Mind’s final form is pretty Evangelion-level freaky. Plus it’s got Mary.
  • Billy Batson & The Magic of Shazam! (2008) | A continuation of Monster Society as a series. The story is fine but the art… we are so strong as fans.
  • Shazam! Power of Hope (2000)* | Alex Ross art + the lesson learned makes this feel like it should be an after school special, but it holds Billy’s essence really well.
  • Superman/Shazam: First Thunder (2005) | Me, normally: shut up about clark adopting billy / Me when reading this: … fine just this once
  • Shazam!: The New Beginning (1987) | This was retconned out once TPoS released, and reintroduces Black Adam and Sivana.

NEW 52 + REBIRTH

  • Shazam! (2013) | Geoff Johns’ first run at New 52 Shazam. Not the best characterization in my opinion, but it establishes the basics.
  • Shazam! (2019)* | Currently ongoing. Billy lives with the Vasquez family along with Freddy, Mary, Eugene, Pedro, and Darla. He can also split the power among them all. He loves his family… so much.

MULTIVERSE

  • Convergence Shazam!* | Say “thank you, Doc Shaner” because this is a balm after Geoff’s 52 run. It combines classic with modern very well and the art and characterization is just *chef kiss*!
  • The Multiversity: Thunderworld Adventures | Takes place in a world apart from the DCU. Sivana stars as the main villain!

PRE-CRISIS

  • Action Comics #583, 675, 690, 692, 720, 768, 782, 800, 804, 826, 829
  • Wonder Woman Vol 2 #8, 59, 62, 126, 165, 173, 175, 188, 2120
  • World’s Finest #253-260, 262-270, 273-276, 278, 280-282
  • Crisis on Infinite Earths #6, 7, 10-12
  • Legends (1986) #1-3, 5, 6

POST-CRISIS

  • Justice League of America (2006) #0, 1, 7, 43, 50, 54
  • Justice (2007) #1, 6, 8, 9,12
  • Justice League International (1987) #1-6
  • JLA: Classified (2005) #5, 8, 9, 44
  • JLA (1997) #14, 26, 28-31, 39, 41, 69, 76, 112, 113, 120
  • JSA (1999)* #26, 27, 33-37, 40-52, 54, 59, 60, 73-75, 78
  • Black Adam: The Dark Age (2007) #1, 2, 4, 5
  • Day of Judgement & Day of Vengance
  • Countdown to Final Crisis (2007) #20, 41, 43-45
  • Countdown #38, 43, 44, 51
  • 52 (2006) #6, 11, 12, 16, 43, 45, 50
  • Genesis (1997)

NEW 52 + REBIRTH

  • The New 52: Futures End (2014) #2, 6, 8-11, 15-19, 22, 25, 28, 36-42, 45, 47, 48
  • Justice League (2012) #0, 7-12, 14-16, 18-23, 30-36, 38, 39, 41-52
  • Justice League of America (2013) Vol 3 #6, 7.4, 8-11, 13, 14
  • Justice League Dark (2011) #22, 23
  • Cyborg (2015)* #1, 3, 6, 8-10

MULTIVERSE

  • Kingdom Come (1996) #2, 3, 4
  • Injustice: Ground Zero #1, 9-12, 20, 21
  • Injustice Gods Among Us: Year Two #9-12, 16, 22
  • Injustice Gods Among Us: Year Three #5, 8-10, 13, 16-24
  • Injustice Gods Among Us: Year Four #1-3, 5, 11-15, 17, 19, 21, 22, 24

*MY PERSONAL FAVES

These are only some of the many features Billy has had in comics across the board, but the ones I’ve listed should be enough to get you a good grasp on his character! You can also check out the Wiki or ComicVine for more listed appearances.

He has been a member of the Justice League, Justice Society, Marvel Family and Squadron of Justice. Captain Marvel was created by C.C.   • Justice League International (1987) #1-6
  • JLA: Classified (2005) #5, 8, 9, 44
  • JLA (1997) #14, 26, 28-31, 39, 41, 69, 76, 112, 113, 120
  • JSA (1999)* #26, 27, 33-37, 40-52, 54, 59, 60, 73-75, 78
  • Black Adam: The Dark Age (2007) #1, 2, 4, 5
  • Day of Judgement & Day of Vengance
  • Countdown to Final Crisis (2007) #20, 41, 43-45
  • Countdown #38, 43, 44, 51
  • 52 (2006) #6, 11, 12, 16, 43, 45, 50
  • Genesis (1997)

NEW 52 + REBIRTH

  • The New 52: Futures End (2014) #2, 6, 8-11, 15-19, 22, 25, 28, 36-42, 45, 47, 48
  • Justice League (2012) #0, 7-12, 14-16, 18-23, 30-36, 38, 39, 41-52
  • Justice League of America (2013) Vol 3 #6, 7.4, 8-11, 13, 14
  • Justice League Dark (2011) #22, 23
  • Cyborg (2015)* #1, 3, 6, 8-10

MULTIVERSE

  • Kingdom Come (1996) #2, 3, 4
  • Injustice: Ground Zero #1, 9-12, 20, 21
  • Injustice Gods Among Us: Year Two #9-12, 16, 22
  • Injustice Gods Among Us: Year Three #5, 8-10, 13, 16-24
  • Injustice Gods Among Us: Year Four #1-3, 5, 11-15, 17, 19, 21, 22, 24

blog.name: mcucosmic
blog.title: MCU Cosmic
blog.description: Covering the Marvel Cinematic Universe on Earth...and beyond!

title: 12 High-Res Captain Marvel Stills Released
body:
Marvel Studios has released twelve high-resolution stills from Captain Marvel.

These are mostly film frames taken from the two released trailers, but they’re much higher quality than you’d get from taking a screen shot from one of the YouTube videos.

With there now being 70 days until the release of Captain Marvel, there’s going to be a lot more content on the way as the marketing campaign really…

View On WordPress

blog.name: fantasticescapism
blog.title: Fantastic Escapism
blog.description: Storyteller and fan girl. Multifandom. There are spoilers here; be warned

tags: that's my take on end game and tony's fate
summary: Some people think Tony is not the type that would retire. They say Tony would keep on worrying about protecting Earth and thus...
body:
Some people think Tony is not the type that would retire. They say Tony would keep on worrying about protecting Earth and thus the only ending for him is to sacrifice his life.

People tend to forget that Captain Marvel is coming, one that is the strongest character in the MCU so far as per Kevin Feige.

Tony hoped for a means to protect the world like a bouncer in the sky. That’s what Ultron was supposed to be. Who else has the means to guard Earth via space? Captain Marvel. In the comics, she is the commander of the Alpha Flight Space Program; simply put it is the bouncer in the sky.

Once Tony’s assured that Earth is in good hands, his fight is over then he can retire and go home with Pepper.

Tony hoped for a means to protect the world like a bouncer in the sky. That’s what Ultron was supposed to be. Who else has the means to guard Earth via space? Captain Marvel. In the comics, she is the commander of the Alpha Flight Space Program; simply put it is the bouncer in the sky.

Once Tony’s assured that Earth is in good hands, his fight is over then he can retire and go home with Pepper.

Some people think Tony is not the type that would retire. They say Tony would keep on worrying about protecting Earth and thus the only ending for him is to sacrifice his life.

People tend to forget that Captain Marvel is coming, one that is the strongest character in the MCU so far as per Kevin Feige.

Tony hoped for a means to protect the world like a bouncer in the sky. That’s what Ultron was supposed to be. Who else has the means to guard Earth via space? Captain Marvel. In the comics, she is the commander of the Alpha Flight Space Program; simply put it is the bouncer in the sky.

Once Tony’s assured that Earth is in good hands, his fight is over then he can retire and go home with Pepper.
trail.content:
Some people think Tony is not the type that would retire. They say Tony would keep on worrying about protecting Earth and thus the only ending for him is to sacrifice his life.

People tend to forget that Captain Marvel is coming, one that is the strongest character in the MCU so far as per Kevin Feige.

Tony hoped for a means to protect the world like a bouncer in the sky. That’s what Ultron was supposed to be. Who else has the means to guard Earth via space? Captain Marvel. In the comics, she is the commander of the Alpha Flight Space Program; simply put it is the bouncer in the sky.

Once Tony’s assured that Earth is in good hands, his fight is over then he can retire and go home with Pepper.

summary: Marvel Studios: Anyway, we’re finally ready to tell you that Jude Law’s character in Captain Marvel is...............
body:
Marvel Studios: Anyway, we’re finally ready to tell you that Jude Law’s character in Captain Marvel is………… Mar-Vell!

Literally everyone who knows anything at all about Captain Marvel and her origin story: Wow. I’m so shocked. Color me surprised. Who could’ve guessed it.

summary: Jude Law protagonista della nuova foto di Captain Marvel
title: Jude Law protagonista della nuova foto di Captain Marvel
body:
#JudeLaw protagonista della nuova foto di #CaptainMarvel

Fandango ha rilasciato in queste ore una nuova foto ufficiale tratta da Captain Marvel, il cinecomic Marvel Studios diretto da Anna Boden e Ryan Fleck.

Il nuovo scatto mostra Brie Larson in compagnia di Jude Law, quest’ultimo nei panni di Mar-Vell, storico leader della Starforce. Il ruolo dell’attore è stato finora al centro di speculazioni da parte della stampa in rete, a tal proposito,…

summary: Captain Marvel: Jude Law in uniforme in una nuova immagine
title: Captain Marvel: Jude Law in uniforme in una nuova immagine
body:
Captain Marvel: Jude Law in uniforme in una nuova immagine

Jude Law guida una squadra di guerrieri Kree in una nuova immagine da Captain Marvel, il cinecomic Marvel Studios atteso per il prossimo anno.

Il nuovo Capitano arriverà nei cinema a marzo e presenterà ai fan Carol Danvers, interpretata da Brie Larson, prima che il suo potente personaggio arrivi ad aiutare gli eroi più potenti della Terra in Avengers: Endgame. Danvers non sarà l’unico…

View On WordPress

You can find gifs, updates and various resources about the universe on this page. We track #dailymarvelheroes, in case you wanted us to check out your edits!

summary: Jude Law’s Mystery Role In 'Captain Marvel' Officially Revealed
body:
Jude Law’s Mystery Role In ‘Captain Marvel’ Officially Revealed

Jude Law’s role in Captain Marvel has been officially revealed in Captain Marvel and it’s…exactly who you think it is. A new slide for the upcoming female superhero film reveals that Jude Law is playing Mar-Vell, the leader of Starforce. So everyone who guessed and speculated about Law’s mystery role in the film, you were right on the money.

The official Captain Marvel page on Disney’s website has a slide revealing that Jude Law will play the Mar-Vell role. While there was speculation to this since his casting, there was nothing concrete. And Jude Law himself had denied in interviews that he was going to play Mar-Vell in the Captain Marvel film. Well, actors do have to protect their roles, after all. Consider: Benedict Cumberbatch denied that he was playing Khan in Star Trek Into Darkness. Marion Cotillard denied playing Talia in The Dark Knight Rises.
